usefulItems: square cake tin (20 cm x 20 cm), baking paper, large bowl, bowl, oven, refrigerator
title: Layered chocolate orange slice

ingredients.content: 160 g unsalted butter, plus extra for greasing
70 g chocolate, orange flavoured, broken into pieces
120 g dark chocolate, 70% cocoa solids, broken into pieces
1 orange, zest only, no white pith

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and line a square baking tin (20 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place orange flavoured chocolate into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place 160 g butter and dark chocolate into mixing bowl and melt <b>3 min/60°C/speed 2<b>, or until melted.
Add sugar and eggs and mix <b>15 sec/speed 3<b>.

Add vanilla extract, salt and flour and mix <b>20 sec/speed 3<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then mix for a further <b>5 sec/speed 3<b>. Transfer half of the brownie mixture into a large bowl and set aside.
Transfer remaining brownie mixture in mixing bowl into the bowl with the crushed orange flavoured chocolate. Combine with spatula, then pour into prepared baking tin.
Bake for 10-15 minutes (180°C) or until just set. Set aside to cool in tin. Keep oven temperature at 180°C.
Place orange zest and sugar into mixing bowl and mill <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then mill for a further <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>.

<b>Insert butterfly whisk.<b> Add orange juice, orange liqueur, unsalted butter and eggs and cook <b>9 min/80°C/speed 3<b>, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid. Transfer orange curd into a bowl and set aside to cool completely.
Spoon cooled orange curd over cooled brownie layer in baking tin and smooth out leaving a ½ cm gap around the edges.
Carefully spoon the remaining brownie mixture over the curd in baking tin, then bake for 15-20 minutes (180°C).
Allow to cool completely in tin, then place into refrigerator for 1 hour. Cut into small pieces and serve.
